Package core

Class TicketPool

java.lang.Object
core.TicketPool
public class TicketPool extends Object
The TicketPool class manages a pool of tickets for an event, supporting operations like adding and removing tickets, checking ticket availability, and tracking the total number of tickets available in the pool. This class is synchronized to allow thread-safe access to the ticket pool.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    TicketPool(String event, int maxTicketCapacity, int customerRetrievalRate, int ticketReleaseRate)
    Constructs a TicketPool object for the given event with specified ticket capacity and rates for customer retrieval and ticket release.

  • Constructor Details

    • TicketPool

      public TicketPool(String event, int maxTicketCapacity, int customerRetrievalRate, int ticketReleaseRate)
      Constructs a TicketPool object for the given event with specified ticket capacity and rates for customer retrieval and ticket release.
      Parameters:
      event - The name of the event for which the ticket pool is being created.
      maxTicketCapacity - The maximum number of tickets that can be in the pool.
      customerRetrievalRate - The rate at which customers can retrieve tickets.
      ticketReleaseRate - The rate at which vendors can release tickets into the pool.

  • Method Details

    • getEvent

      public String getEvent()

    • setEvent

      public void setEvent(String event)

    • getMaxTicketCapacity

      public int getMaxTicketCapacity()

    • getCustomerRetrievalRate

      public int getCustomerRetrievalRate()

    • getTicketReleaseRate

      public int getTicketReleaseRate()

    • addTicket

      public boolean addTicket(String vendor)
      Adds a ticket to the pool, if the capacity allows.
      Parameters:
      vendor - The vendor releasing the ticket.
      Returns:
      true if the ticket is successfully added, false if the pool is full.

    • removeTicket

      public boolean removeTicket(String buyer)
      Removes a ticket from the pool, allowing a customer to purchase it. If no tickets are available, it will wait until one is released.
      Parameters:
      buyer - The customer buying the ticket.
      Returns:
      true if the ticket is successfully purchased, false if the pool is sold out.

    • isPoolFull

      public boolean isPoolFull()
      Checks if the ticket pool is full (whether the total tickets added are equal to the max capacity).
      Returns:
      true if the pool is full, false otherwise.

    • isSoldOut

      public boolean isSoldOut()
      Checks if the ticket pool is sold out (no tickets left in pool and the total tickets have reached the max capacity).
      Returns:
      true if the pool is sold out, false otherwise.
